docs.snippet: Federal authorities in New York have sued Deutsche Bank and other financial entities, alleging they dodged more than $100 million in taxes with some fancy financial footwork....

headline.main: US Sues Deutsche Bank and Other Banks for $190M
headline.print_headline: US Sues Deutsche Bank and Other Banks for $190M

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities in New York have sued Deutsche Bank and other financial entities, alleging they dodged more than $100 million in taxes with some fancy financial footwork.

docs.snippet: Suburban Detroit authorities have filed first-degree murder charges against a 65-year-old woman they say slashed her son's throat and then fatally beat her 7-month-old granddaughter....

headline.main: Woman Charged With Killing Her Son, Granddaughter
headline.print_headline: Woman Charged With Killing Her Son, Granddaughter

docs.lead_paragraph: Suburban Detroit authorities have filed first-degree murder charges against a 65-year-old woman they say slashed her son's throat and then fatally beat her 7-month-old granddaughter.

docs.snippet: The Senate has passed a bill to update the Freedom of Information Act....

headline.main: Senate Passes Measure to Improve FOIA
headline.print_headline: Senate Passes Measure to Improve FOIA

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate has passed a bill to update the Freedom of Information Act.

docs.snippet: A special auditor's report concluded there was a discrepancy between the price paid for German cable firm Kabel Deutschland by Britain's Vodafone and the value of the company....

headline.main: Auditor Finds Discrepancy in Kabel Deutschland Takeover Price
headline.print_headline: Auditor Finds Discrepancy in Kabel Deutschland Takeover Price

docs.lead_paragraph: A special auditor's report concluded there was a discrepancy between the price paid for German cable firm Kabel Deutschland by Britain's Vodafone and the value of the company.

docs.snippet: A "Black Friday" shopping spree pushed British retail sales growth to a three-month high in November as shoppers splashed out on household goods and furniture, according to an industry survey on Tuesday....

headline.main: 'Black Friday' Discounts Boost Retail Sales in November-BRC
headline.print_headline: 'Black Friday' Discounts Boost Retail Sales in November-BRC

docs.lead_paragraph: A "Black Friday" shopping spree pushed British retail sales growth to a three-month high in November as shoppers splashed out on household goods and furniture, according to an industry survey on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: An Arab-American activist convicted of failing to tell U.S. immigration officials about her conviction for a fatal bombing in Israel can be released from jail if she comes up with $50,000 cash, a federal judge in Detroit said Monday....

headline.main: Bond for Arab Activist Who Hid Israel Bombing Role
headline.print_headline: Bond for Arab Activist Who Hid Israel Bombing Role

docs.lead_paragraph: An Arab-American activist convicted of failing to tell U.S. immigration officials about her conviction for a fatal bombing in Israel can be released from jail if she comes up with $50,000 cash, a federal judge in Detroit said Monday.

docs.snippet: A guard at New York City's Rikers Island jail complex was indicted on Monday for failing to keep watch the night a mentally ill, homeless Marine Corps veteran died in a cell with heat topping 100 degrees Fahrenheit (38 degrees Celsius)...

headline.main: NYC Jail Guard Charged in Connection With Inmate's Death
headline.print_headline: NYC Jail Guard Charged in Connection With Inmate's Death

docs.lead_paragraph: A guard at New York City's Rikers Island jail complex was indicted on Monday for failing to keep watch the night a mentally ill, homeless Marine Corps veteran died in a cell with heat topping 100 degrees Fahrenheit (38 degrees Celsius)

docs.snippet: Chicago police said on Monday they are investigating an incident caught on video during a weekend protest that appears to show a  Chicago police car blasting the song "Sweet Home Alabama."...

headline.main: Chicago Police Investigate Video of Cop Car Playing 'Alabama' Song
headline.print_headline: Chicago Police Investigate Video of Cop Car Playing 'Alabama' Song

docs.lead_paragraph: Chicago police said on Monday they are investigating an incident caught on video during a weekend protest that appears to show a  Chicago police car blasting the song "Sweet Home Alabama."

docs.snippet: Reigning Heisman winner Jameis Winston is not a finalist for this year's award....

headline.main: Jameis Winston Not a Heisman Finalist This Year
headline.print_headline: Jameis Winston Not a Heisman Finalist This Year

docs.lead_paragraph: Reigning Heisman winner Jameis Winston is not a finalist for this year's award.

docs.snippet: JALON--Cyril. The Board of Governors and members of Beach Point Club note with deep sorrow the passing of our fellow member, Cyril Jalon, and extend sincere condolences to his family. James Dreyfus, President...
docs.lead_paragraph:
JALON--Cyril. The Board of Governors and members of Beach Point Club note with deep sorrow the passing of our fellow member, Cyril Jalon, and extend sincere condolences to his family.

James Dreyfus, President
